TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void SubmitEventHandler(object sender, SubmitEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed SubmitEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub SubmitEventHandler(sender As Object, e As SubmitEventArgs)
public delegate void SubmitEventHandler(System::Object ^ sender, SubmitEventArgs ^ e);
type SubmitEventHandler = delegate of obj * SubmitEventArgs -> unit

Docs.param: A object that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event of a form.

remarks.para: Important: The code skeleton for an event handler associated with the Submit event, which uses the SubmitEventHandler delegate, should be added only from the Microsoft InfoPath user interface. For more information on how to add event handlers in InfoPath, see How Do I: Add an Event Handler.
This type or member can be accessed from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler or in a Web browser.

example.para: For an example of using the SubmitEventHandler delegate, see the sample code in the Submit event of the class.
